On 19 Oct, Mike Clark wrote:
> Laurent Duperval wrote:
> 
>> On 19 Oct, Mik=
e Clark wrote:
>> > Perhaps a look at the TransactionTestCase.setUp() would=
 help, as this
>> > seems to be the differentiator.
>> >
> 
> The UserTrans=
action is enlisting all the EJB resources, but I suspect that
> the transac=
tion isolation levels are causing the finder to only read
> committed data,=
 and the call to setDefault(true) isn't being committed.
> 

That's what we=
 suspect also. Other than removing the Transaction, do you (or
anyone else)=
 have a suggestion for us to correct this?

L
